subject: Climate & Environment
title: The Human Right to Water
description: A quick win: understand The Human Right to Water.

hook.text: In 2010, the United Nations declared access to clean water a fundamental human right.

buildup.text: Despite this, 2.2 billion people still lack access to safely managed drinking water.

discovery.text: The cost of providing universal clean water is estimated at $114 billion per year.

twist.text: The world spends more than that on bottled water alone every year.

climax.text: Solving the water crisis is not a technology problem. It is a priorities problem.

punchline.text: We have the money. We have the tools. We just need the will.

quiz.question: When did the UN declare clean water a human right?
